tier.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: one of several levels or layers that rise up one above the other
tier.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: Terraces of olive trees rose in tiers.
tier.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: one of several levels in an organization or system
tier.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: The second tier of the programme is in-house training.
the most senior tier of management
tier.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: one of several levels of quality, usually three
tier.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: Investors are going for the better value represented by middle-tier and lower-tier junk bonds  (=bonds that have a high risk of not being repaid).
Iberia will build its subsidiary into a second-tier airline offering discounted flights.
